text: Wow, thanks so much guys. Really appreciate your feedback and will do apache benchmark testing and testing under "load" as well. On further reading GTmetrix docs i noticed that they mention a 2 second delay to monitor "no network" activity so maybe that's also contributing to higher full page load times "raw i mean". <@U2H3TT8F2> <@UBLH6MN2Z> thanks again

one quick question though. i see with google's page speed insights and GTmetrix both highlight to defer javascript rendering. How do you guys handle this ?  I mean afaik HubSpot doesn't allow this right?
Iâ€™ve spent a year building a PWA, Lighthouse can be your friend :slightly_smiling_face: <https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/>
<@U79N5J2AU> depending on the JS being added, a majority of it will be HS and I dont believe there is a way to defer it at the moment.
